text.0: by manus law was born this agni priest most skilled born for the holy work of those who yearn therefore yea born for his own holy work.
text.1: all ear to him who seeks his love and wealth to him who strives for fame.
text.2: priest neer deceived he sits in iḷās holy place girt round in iḷās holy place.
text.3: we call that perfecter of worship by the path or sacrifice with reverence rich in offerings with worship rich in offerings.
text.4: through presentation of our food he grows not old in this his from.
text.5: the god whom mātariśvan brought from far away for manu brought from far away.
text.6: in ordered course forthwith he traverses the earth swiftswallowing bellowing steer bearing the genial seed bearing the seed and bellowing.
text.7: observant with a hundred eyes the god is conqueror in the wood.
text.8: agni who hath his seat in broad plains here below and in the high lands far away.
text.9: that agni wise highpriest in every house takes thought for sacrifice and holy service yea takes thought with mental power for sacrifice.
text.10: disposer he with mental power shows all things unto him who strives.
text.11: whence he was born a guest enriched with holy oil born as ordainer and as priest.
text.12: when through his power and in his strong prevailing flames the maruts gladdening boons mingle with agnis roar boons gladdening for the active one.
text.13: then he accelerates the gift and by the greatness of his wealth.
text.14: shall rescue us from overwhelming misery from curse and overwhelming woe.
text.15: vast universal good he was made messenger the speeder with his right hand hath not loosed his hold through love of fame not loosed his hold.
text.16: he bears oblations to the gods for whosoever supplicates.
text.17: agni bestows a blessing on each pious man and opens wide the doors for him.
text.18: that agni hath been set most kind in camp of men in sacrifice like a lord victorious like a dear lord in sacred rites.
text.19: his are the oblations of mankind when offered up at iḷās place.
text.20: he shall preserve us from varuṇas chastisement yea from the great gods chastisement.
text.21: agni the priest they supplicate to grant them wealth him dear most thoughtful have they made their messenger him offeringbearer have they made.
text.22: beloved of all who knoweth all the priest the holy one the sage.
text.23: him friend for help the gods when they are fain for wealth him friend with hymns when fain for wealth.
